sentences.sContent: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.sContent_eng: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.sCn: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.sContent: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.sContent_eng: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.sCn: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

remMethod.val: caj(=cage笼子) + ole → 把(鸟)诱入笼子 → 哄骗

trans.tranOther: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them
